triples.name: Theory to explain overprecision
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new theory that overprecision results from neglect of all the ways in which one could be wrong.

triples.name: Overconfidence effect
triples.relevance: Overprecision is a manifestation of the broader overconfidence effect in human judgment.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how overprecision exists not only among people but also among artificially intelligent agents.

triples.name: Judgment and Decision Making
triples.relevance: The paper explains overprecision as excessive certainty in the accuracy of one's judgment.

triples.name: Cognitive bias
triples.relevance: Overprecision is a systematic pattern of deviation from rationality in judgment, a type of cognitive bias.
